quotes.quote: Make the most of the Indian hemp seed and sow it everywhere.
I don't know what they have done to pot in the last thirty years, but it rocks!
That stoner thing cuts across political lines.

They have done study after study on this issue of marijuana—every administration since, like, FDR. You know what they found out? It makes you want to eat SpaghettiOs right out of the saucepan. That's the worst thing.

Life seems to be very complicated in every place of the world. Most of us are anxious from time to time. Most of us are depressed from time to time. We want to change that. In many cases. such a change can be brought forward by cannabis. That's why people use it.
Mom, I'm selling weed. It's as close to recession-proof as it gets.
In the past we had a little smoke, the odd toke... Everyone has a little smoke once in a while, you know. It's one of life's little pleasures.

You have to allot at least seven and three-quarters minutes of fake interest in the person holding the weed. Say something nice about them or their stuff, like, 'Cool pipe,' or, 'Wow, that's a neat lizard.'
If you're Jewish, do not smoke weed and go to the Anne Frank house. That is a terrible combination; you will think the Nazis are after you.
It's more of a herb. I don't regret saying that at all. I think everyone smokes weed and people who say they don't are lying.
To the merry man, every weed is a flower; to the afflicted man, every flower is a weed.
Ignorance is an evil weed, which dictators may cultivate among their dupes, but which no democracy can afford among its citizens.
Slavery they can have anywhere. It is a weed that grows in every soil.
What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have not been discovered.
O thou weed, who act so lovely fair, and smells't so sweet, that the sense aches at thee, would thou hadst never been born!

Only in the use of the Indian weed he might be thought a little excessive. He took it, he would say, as a solvent of speech. Marry—as the friendly vapour ascended, how his prattle would curl up sometimes with it! the ligaments which tongue-tied him, were loosened, and the stammerer proceeded a satist [statesman]!

I hate museums; there is nothing so weighs upon my spirits. They are the catacombs of nature. One green bud of spring, one willow catkin, one faint trill from a migrating sparrow would set the world on its legs again. The life that is in a single green weed is of more worth than all this death.
Go oft to the house of thy friend, for weeds choke the unused path.
When I was a kid I inhaled frequently. That was the point.
Why is marijuana against the law? It grows naturally upon our planet. Doesn’t the idea of making nature against the law seem to you a bit . . . unnatural?
That is not a drug, it’s a leaf.
I will never give up the ganja – God's own weed.
I enjoy smoking cannabis and see no harm in it.

It's actually growing from the ground straight to you, so it's just like eating a vegetable. You know what I'm saying? Cancer and diseases that never had a cure, now all of a sudden you got people taking chemotherapy, and they're also having a toke, and they live longer.

I do smoke, but I don't go through all this trouble just because I want to make my drug of choice legal. It's about personal freedom. We should have the right in this country to do what we want, if we don't hurt anybody.
I have to do what's right, weed is for the people, it's the peoples weed.
Feller told me one time they got a weed down here and they call it loco weed. When the horses and cows eat it they get wilder than all get out.
Nobody forgets about $300 worth of blow... unless they smoked a whole bag of weed first!
Weed isn't supposed to be some money-grubbin' business model! It's a gift from God! And not something to exploited by some stupid towel!

Now I am a plant, a weed, / Bending and swinging / On a rocky ledge; / And now I am a long brown grass / Fluttering like flame; / I am a reed; / An old shell singing / For ever the same; / A drift of sedge; / A white, white stone; / A bone; / Until I pass / Into sand again, / And spin and blow / To and fro, to and fro, / On the edge of the sea / In the fading light-- / For the light fades.
